website_summaries.verdict: The Lenovo Tab 2 A10-70 offers one of the sharpest HD screens for the price, making it an attractively affordable option for heavy video-watchers.
pros: The Lenovo Tab 2 A10-70 is an affordable tablet with a full HD screen
The pre-loaded Dolby app significantly improves audio quality
It has a microSD card slot to increase its base storage capacity
cons: Large games take a undesirably long time to load
The tablet feels uncomfortable after holding it for a long time

customer_reviews.title: I purchased 9 of these tablets. The website says ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 9 of these tablets. The website says the following: 1.5 GHz ARM Cortex A53 Quad-Core 16 GB Flash Memory, 2 GB RAM Memory 10.1 inches FHD IPS LCD (1920x1200) Display NONE of it is true. I received 1.3GHZ, 1 GB RAM Memory, and 1920 x 780 display. Amazon needs to change the tech specs so that customers are not losing time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: Just too many problems with this tablet. Wifi connection bouncing all over the place, dropped signal, weak signal and overall just poor even while sitting 10 feet from the wireless router. 2 other wifi devices never have problem. Dolby Atmos sound software goes null after using other programs that use voice or sounds such as Google Maps giving directions or playing music the sound volume will go to something like 20%. SD card unexpectedly remove is a never ending battle. These things can be reset after stopping and clearing cache the restart tablet but should this be necessary, Really.. When it is working you are on a hope and prayer. Buy something else, anything...
customer_reviews.author: Yea I Bought It

customer_reviews.title: Mouse sound.  Rest of tablet great
customer_reviews.text: Got it today and seems to be a great tablet, except for the sound. Very very weak. Turned up all the way it's like having it on 3 on anything else. Update: installed speaker boost and that helped tremendously. Set it up to 4%. Update: Dolby never did work on my tablet. App controls were always unresponsive. So I did a little researching and found out if u factory reset it it will start working. Tried that and it works great now and definite improvement in the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S. Fraley

customer_reviews.title: Not to be used for Games or Movies!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this tablet when I first got it but after having it 6 months, the wifi keeps going down. I changed my modem, my router everything and then realized that my laptop never went down. Just my two Lenovo tablets. AFter much research, I discovered that this is common in this tablet. The wifi keeps going down and the only way to restart is to shut off the tablet and turn it back on. And that works until the next time you put the tablet down for a short period of time. There is a definite problem with this tablet
customer_reviews.author: TripleMom

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Liked the entire tablet when received. It does have a slower operating system but it would be good for kids. However, after having it for two and a half weeks , it became very erratic going between it shutting off, coming on etc. then it would work for a bit then repeat all the shifting back & forth. After a few days of this, the battery wouldn't charge all the way. It finally died when the lenov logoo screen froze. I returned it with a replacement tab.I feel that giving it another chance would be a fair assessment . will update as to what happens.
customer_reviews.author: ELLe

customer_reviews.title: after 4 weeks the charging cable - doesn't quite connect anymore => tablet can't recharge.
customer_reviews.text: It works fine, and I love the device. BUT the cable end, that connects to the device, it somehow doesn't connect and therefore the tablet won't charge :( The device can be greater than great and eventually a frustrating experience if recharging is not really working, after only 4 weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Trumpfheller

customer_reviews.title: Had trouble staying connected to WiFi and it was tiresome. Eventually it would no longer charge because the ...
customer_reviews.text: This tablet has always caused me trouble. Had trouble staying connected to WiFi and it was tiresome. I often had to wait minutes for pages to load because of the poor connection. As I looked around the net for solutions I discovered that a lot of people were having the same problem with this tablet. They also mentioned that Lenovo was no help at all when they complained. Eventually this tablet would no longer charge because the charging port became loose. It is now a very expensive paper weight. I used it less than a year and a half. It wasnt heavy usage either. I can't recommend this tablet. I have a Samsung now and it's a much better experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ricine

customer_reviews.title: I love this tablet and I have read several reviews from ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the TAB2 A10-70. 16 GB Storage with 2GB RAM, and 1.7 Ghz processor. I love this tablet and I have read several reviews from CNET, and other sites that didn't really give good reviews on performance. I have not tried this with any intense 3D games and have not pushed super hard, but it is very good performance and as soon as you start it, go to About Tablet and get the updates for newer Android OS. If you are looking for a solid performer with 2GB RAM and good processor, under $200... this is the one. I highly recommend and everyone in my family now has one (wife and both kids!)
customer_reviews.author: D. Spach

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tablet, awesome price point
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a lot of Android devices. I wanted this tablet to replace an aging yet still functional Nexus 10. It excels at everything my old tablet did plus has the battery life unsurpassed by any of my former tablets. The screen is wonderful for the price and absolutely fits the bill to watch media, youtube and troll people on Reddit. It's fast, responsive and cheap. If you want a tablet to replace a laptop, look elsewhere. If you want to watch movies in bed and browse craigslist, without any lag or battery limitations, buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet... Save one Major issue...
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a great tablet... graphics are superb, no problems with lag, even on the games I play. Sound is weak, but no big deal for me as I keep it turned way down anyway. Movies are good, no problems, and when using headphone/earbuds, a good stereo sound. But... one major problem that causes a low rating; WIFI. It pitiful at best, drops connection very often, even when I'm within 3 feet of the router!! I hope it's a software issue and Lenovo gets it fixed quickly. Until then I cannot recommend this tablet to others. If and when it is fixed, then I'll increase the number of stars.
customer_reviews.author: eppytx

customer_reviews.title: Lenovo Tab 2 10-Inch 16 GB Tablet (Navy Blue)
customer_reviews.text: Like this tablet a lot so far... This replaced a dead Toshiba Thrive. The Lenova is thin, like the over-priced iPads. The display is striking and the pre-loaded apps are decent. I do not download music, so cannot critique the audio features beyond being adequate for my general usages. It is louder than the Thrive. I am on the second Lenova, as the first one had a slight defect in the screen. I contacted Amazon, and had a new one in my hands in two days, with free return on the defective one. I did, and would, buy this again and recommend it to those wanting an impressive Android tablet.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tomp

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a multimedia consumption device.
customer_reviews.text: Love it (for the money). I wanted a larger tablet with good screen resolution and not too slow. I do not play games, mainly this is for viewing web pages and videos and it's perfect for it. Slick design, minimalist, but stylish. I initially bought one for my wife, but ended up hogging it, so bought her another one. Both were refurbs, so I didn't pay full retail and at those prices it's a great value. I agree with those who say that the charging port, unlock/volume buttons and headphone jack are not in the best position, but for my use I have not had issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Foodie1

customer_reviews.title: Not the Most Long-Lived of Tablets
customer_reviews.text: Well, this device made it from December 2016 until July 2018, exhibited some interesting quirks when attaching to a Wi-Fi location (as in could NOT locate and verify some types) and functioned primarily as a Kindle app reader. Date of death was July 15, 2018. Never a huge fan of Lenovo (overrated in my opinion) and will probably not buy it again. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hirdler

customer_reviews.title: I have bought this tablet for reading books and it is perfect for it (for a tablet)
customer_reviews.text: Previously I had 1st generation Galaxy Tab, so this review might be biased towards Lenovo tablet. I have bought this tablet for reading books and it is perfect for it (for a tablet). The display is crisp, and the tablet is fast enough for swiping pages without lags. The price is great, and it is the only 10 inch Full HD tablet I could find for this money. Weight is great for me, which is 50 gramm lighter then Tab1, but of course much ligter ipad air and tab A are available on the market. By the way browsing is also great on this tab). Overall great value for the price for a book reading tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Kanat

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: I researched the best tablets for under 200 bucks, and this one made the list. Battery life is above average. The display is crystal clear. I like the 10.1 inch size, it offers best balance for web surfing, photo editing, etc. I have read Kindle books on this, and am pleased but still, a slight disappointment when comparing it to a Kindle Voyage. I recommend not settling for anything less than 2 GB of ram, and at least a full HD display. This one has both, and for $149.99, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Nunes

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: It was $200 and a bit with taxes and customs charges. Much heavier than my five year old Nexus 7" tablet, but the extra screen space is much appreciated -- it is awkward to hold in one hand, too, while surfing. Battery life is pretty good, too. Within a week of getting it, I watched three movies consecutively on the Netflix and the battery was only down to about fifty percent or so. Would recommend for gaming or surfing or reading.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Lebowski

customer_reviews.title: Lighter, Faster, Super
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace malfunctioning Asus Transformer (TF103C). It is 2 oz. lighter, much faster and (surprise) came with Android 5.01. Faster on downloads, too. Very happy with this selection. UPDATE: I am still loving this tablet. If I have a regret, it is that I didn't buy the 32 GB version. I have had no isus whatsoever and expect a longer life-time from this product than other tablets I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Dale West

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for everyday life
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet. Not for gaming though. I knew that before purchase but just so you do not buy it thinking it will play games fast. It will handle the usual Candy Crush or Angry birds but no racing games. Movies play great. You plays great. Surfing is smooth. Battery life is great. Playing videos and watching Youtube battery lasts 15hrs. Screen was set at Med-Low setting (this is still very bright). The headphone port is in the top of the tablet so when oriented in the landscape position the cable has to be tucked behind the unit. That and the backward facing speakers are my only complaints. This is a great tablet. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So long Apple....... This Tab Rocks...
customer_reviews.text: I love this tab period...... I was nervous about leaving apple iPad but no more. As far as I'm concerned I'm done with apple and there constant incessant updates and every time you update it slows down until you can't use it no more. I wonder if that is their market strategy??? Anyway this tablet far exceeds the iPad and I can expand the memory. Not possible with apple..... Android has also come a long way in recent versions and is just as good if not better than apple. Completely satisfied. Now if I can just get to the end of my Iphone contract I'll be going with Android on that also...... So long overpriced Apple......
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Toft

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 7 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE! If you are looking for a tablet that lasts for more than 1 year do not get this one. Spend a little bit more for a higher quality tablet. I bought this tablet 7 months ago and now it won't turn on and will not charge. I mainly use it for reading pdfs and documents. I was highly disappointed. It is an amazing tablet for the first half a year though. I was a bit skeptical of other reviews stating it broke down under a year until it happened to me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Why waste several hundred dollars elsewhere?
customer_reviews.text: I love my tablet. Why spend several hundred dollars on an iPad or Samsung? This does exactly what it's supposed to do, as well as it's supposed to do. I think the only thing that is missing is voice, but that's nothing that I can't replicate on my phone, or my PC (do I *REALLY* need that on every device that I own? REALLY?) I haven't had any problems with it. The only issue I really have with it is that the battery life on it isn't very long. If I'm using it, I'll charge it every other day. Again...I don't think you need to spend all of that money elsewhere, unless you're looking to show off.
customer_reviews.author: lapis lazuli

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet after doing a lot of research. Turned out to be one of the best things I've bought on Amazon. Amazing bang for your buck. I use it more than my iPad mini 3 and Samsung tablet and those are almost four times the price! Powerful enough to play 3d games without any lag. Screen resolution is great and clear as crystal. Amazing battery outlasts all the other devices I have. The only small downside to this tablet are the weak speakers, but if you're like me and mostly use headphones this is not a problem at all. Overall amazing purchase - hard to believe it's as cheap as it is.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tsirozidis

customer_reviews.title: like many other more recent reviews fails to hold a ...
customer_reviews.text: This tablet, like many other more recent reviews fails to hold a charge. At one point I thought I was going a little crazy when the tablet would indicate low battery even when charged overnight! There is NO known solution for the issues with this tablet and given that there was personal data on the device, I do not want to send it back to Lenovo who may send it overseas for repairs. I am absolutely dissatisfied with IBM/Lenovo and would not recommend this tablet or hardware for purchase. Everyone that is purchasing this tablet now will not encounter issues until about 3-6 months from receiving it. This is unacceptable and frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: JoeCool

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer service
customer_reviews.text: The tablet itself is fine I gave it 3 stars because Lenovo customer service is horrible. The mini usb port stopped charging so I sent it in to be fixed a month ago. The service number they gave me to check the status of repair doesn't work. So I called and I could barely understand the customer service person. Her english was terrible, so I didn't know what the heck she was saying. I was told I would receive my tablet back last week and I still have not received it. Bottom line is I will never buy another Lenovo product.
customer_reviews.author: Fashioncrazy

customer_reviews.title: Decent tablet for the price. Sound could be better though
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 10yr old who dropped her Ipad.. Hopefully that wont happen again but she and I have used this for about 3 months and the performance is good it boots quickly and opens apps fairly quick also. The only complaint for me is the tiny sounding speakers are on the back side facing away from the user which is odd to me. I can hear whatever she is watching on youtube better than her and Im in the other room! Lenovo should have really spent more time on speaker placement and quality.
customer_reviews.author: M White

customer_reviews.title: Whats with the wifi
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tablet for the price. Everything works well except for the wifi. Connection will drop frequently whilst streaming video, or just browsing the web. I noticed other reviews say the wifi shuts off while the tablet is idle. For me, it shuts off while I'm using it. Its very annoying, and I'm on the rocks about returning it. I have installed a wifi lock app, so we'll see if that improves anything. Otherwise, without properly functioning wifi, the tablet is essentially useless.
customer_reviews.author: Dan F

customer_reviews.title: there really is nothing like stock android
customer_reviews.text: I read alot of the reviews for this, I understand that there are some reported problems with upgrading the software, I disabled that in the app section of android. I bought two of these for my nephews, set them up and loaded about 40 games on them. The Lenovo version of android is ok, there really is nothing like stock android....and the bloat ware was easy to take off and the rest was easy to disable. The screen is sweet on this tablet and even after having a bunch off apps open, apps downloading and me just fooling with it the tablet still worked fine, no lag....I'm very satisfied with this for them.
customer_reviews.author: nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Great 10" Tablet for the Price. Be cautious updating the OS
customer_reviews.text: I have generally been quite happy with this tablet. It does not have a blazing fast processor, but for casual use is plenty powerful and provides a great value over some of the much more expensive 10" tablet alternatives. The one drawback I have had is that, based on feedback from others, it is risky to upgrade to the Lollipop version of Android. Others have complained that it really hurts the tablet's sound, while other say it makes the wireless connection unstable. As a result, I have kept running the pre-installed Kit Kat and have to occasionally delete nags for me to update to Lollipop.
customer_reviews.author: AProf

customer_reviews.title: Simple Tablet, Internet playing and video watching.
customer_reviews.text: Simple tablet, it's only meant for light use, meaning entertainment type apps and social media and simple games. I haven't tried any gpu intensive stuff but I've noticed that every once in a while my apps will freeze for a few seconds but, again this no high performance tablet. I reiterate its for goofing around on the net. I'd buy it again, but I already have a lot of high performance electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Brown

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out....
customer_reviews.text: The jury is still out on this product. Initially, the tablet was slow, not very responsive often times to touch. It has gotten progressively better since, perhaps from updates, etc. It still occasionally has a non-responsive touch and I'll have to put it to sleep and then turn it back on again. I am giving it another week or so before deciding if I am keeping it or returning it for a new one. I am sold on the product but may have gotten a dud. To be continued....Everything else, screen, size, weight, etc are as described and I have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: With the right note-taking apps and an easy no-fuss stylus
customer_reviews.text: As a graduate student, I was in search of an affordable tablet that would let me 1) take notes and 2) read digital content (ebooks, pdfs, etc). With the right note-taking apps and an easy no-fuss stylus, this is my note-taking machine! And I can read and annotate pdfs, which is excellent. I've also started using it to stream movies/videos, etc, and it's great for that too!
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money to buy an iPad instead
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for elderly family member. Worked great at first to check email and light web surfing. They got an OTA update 3 months after purchase and now is completely useless. Constant state of reboot. Called Lenovo and the rep said to take it to my local Best Buy for repair even though it was not purchased there. Took it to BB and they said they could not help.
customer_reviews.author: The Grim Meeper

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, and can't believe it only cost $160
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet, and can't believe it only cost $160. It is as fast as my phone for Google Maps, Pandora, and loading websites. I bought this as a kitchen tablet, mounted under my cabinet. It handles my shopping lists, music (paired to Bluetooth speakers), and cooking websites with ease. Far surpasses it's role. This thing comes with hardly any software. This is a really good thing. I could disable a lot of the built-in stuff, which leaves me a lean battery-friendly device. I'm seriously considering buying two more. One for my girl, and one for me to have a for a large map surface when out hiking in Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: Dave A

customer_reviews.title: Nice Android Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Good hardware as I expect from Lenovo. Nice bright screen, very easy to see in bright sunlight. Battery life is a bit on the short side, but may be because this was a used unit with perhaps many recharge cycles on the battery. I have not cracked open the case to install a new battery. With the decreasing cost of 5v power packs, I'll probably just velcro a 20,000 mAh pack to the back of it and use it that way. This will be used WIFI control of a digital mixer and the battery pack makes a nice "handle" to hold it by, leaving my other hand free to operate the mixer controls onscreen.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Nice but heavy tablet
customer_reviews.text: First the not so good. It's heavy and unwieldy after using my Asus MemoPad 7, but I'll probably get used to it. It doesn't have a magnetometer so one of my favorite apps, Skeye, doesn't work. Now the good. The display is really, really good. Full 1920 x 1200, awesome for movies and video. Battery seems to last forever. The tablet is much faster at everything than the MemoPad. Not problems with networking at all. Overall a very good buy at less than $200.
customer_reviews.author: Roblitespeed

customer_reviews.title: Ok as an extra device.
customer_reviews.text: A decent tablet for viewing video, though the volume even after adjusting in the peripheral Dolby app is pretty bad. If you want a cheap tablet to throw in a bag or move around the house to watch video on, this is great, but even simple tasks like web browsing or checking email are sort of a chore. Its response time is that of a 2007 smart phone, and its processor lags quite a bit. I'll be keeping it because for the price, this is about the best display you can get, but if you are planning on replacing a computer or using this for work, it is definitely worth it to spend more money and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good basic tablet
customer_reviews.text: A good basic tablet, a little hard to get used to. My old tablet broke and was too expensive to replace. Yes this is an android tablet but uses a different version of software ( probably older ) than my broken tablet. Works good but very slow operating system and wifi. Bought as a set, tablet, case and screen protector, I could buy 3 of these for the replacement price of my other. Works for me but if you need speed this is not your tablet.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID PETERS

customer_reviews.title: An amazing tablet...
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this tablet. I got it solely for the purpose of browsing without having to use the computer, laptop, or netbook. It worked out-of-the box with minimal setup. While I obviously cannot speak to its long-term durability so far it has not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Not-So-Serious Sam

customer_reviews.title: Just got Tablet 2 days ago and really like it for price of $162
customer_reviews.text: Just got Tablet 2 days ago and really like it for price of $162.99 compared to Samsung S2 Tab at $499.00. YouTube videos look awesome on 1920x1200 screen. Better to use Headphones for listening as speakers little weak, I like Bose headphones. Maps app is really great, you can check emails. Hope tablet will be convenient for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Tablet . Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents as their anniversary gift. They liked it. Very easy to use Great display battery life is pretty good so far Expandable memory, makes this product in front of all of its competitors Touch screen is awesome 10 Inch display works great and pretty good size make sure to buy MICRO SD card with this product purchase Battery charges full in less than 40 mins and it lasts long Very light weighted
customer_reviews.author: Kshah

customer_reviews.title: Solid budget tablet
customer_reviews.text: Solid tablet for the price. One feature that is missing is the ambient light sensor. Other than that it serves the purpose of a secondary tablet which is used by kids. It is light weight and responsive for videos and internet surfing. Does not work well with protective glass, as the protective glass severely decreases the sensitivity of the screen.
customer_reviews.author: solnyshka

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet deal hands down!
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this great tablet for $160 thinking there must be a serious downside. How could it be so cheap? It arrived today and I am totally blown away! This is my third tablet and my favorite. It's super fast, super bright and crisp and all around excellent. Costs half as much as my old slower Google Nexus 9". Buy this!!!! I'm in love and I know electronics! I do tech support for the government for a living. Best deal anywhere. Update: I have the tablet for a few months now. LOVE IT! I cant believe how inexpensive this is compared to other over priced tablets.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: i'm a happy customer
customer_reviews.text: arrived on time and functioned right out of the box. had a 50% charge. very little bloat wear on it. i immediately upgraded the o/s to 6.0.1 and loaded 9 apps that i find useful. no complaints, nary a one
customer_reviews.author: jim harper

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy this product again and don't recommend any one to buy it...
customer_reviews.text: Only on the first three weeks the battery lasted as advertised, now it barely holds a charge for more than a day. Also, there are two areas on the screen that present some blurriness... Will never buy this product again and don't recommend any one to buy it...
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Best Tablet Out There, iPad and Kindle should be ashamed compared to the Lenovo.
customer_reviews.text: I originally got a Kindle Fire because I am all about Amazon. I think Prime is brilliant and I love the great value you get. I also loved my very first Kindle with keyboard. It really changed how I read books. The Kindle Fire, however is just a glorified e-reader, especially when you compare it to the Lenovo. This runs quickly, has an amazing picture, and the speakers are louder than any other tablet I have heard (not loud enough for a party, but OK in a quiet room.) This is one of the best values I have ever seen for the level of technology you get. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brice A. Laris

customer_reviews.title: needed update out of box. when tried to update ...
customer_reviews.text: needed update out of box. when tried to update never worked again. Amazon rep was very helpful. Lenevo rep was not. I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER LENOVO PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good display, good sound
customer_reviews.text: We got this refurbished, and it's a lovely tablet. Good display, good sound, doesn't feel awkward. Camera is centered, so it's harder to get your fingers on it by mistake. This tablet vibrates with each on-screen keystroke, has a responsive screen, has upgraded to the newest android OS with no problems, and gets FM radio when you plug in headphones. All in all, for under $200, it's a great tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Melo

customer_reviews.title: I love this tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet, I've had this tablet for quite a while now and have no complaints. The battery capacity is much larger than I expected, I can watch 6-8 hours of video before needing to recharge. It's a little slow to boot up but once it does it's pretty quick to process. I've dropped this tablet a half dozen times or so and while I don't recommend doing that mine has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Marino

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful tablet for the price. I just bought the Lenovo A12 and I'm loving it as well. Tablet performs, no lags unless I keep a BUNCH of apps open at once. Even then, I just close a few and it picks back up. My only gripe with Lenovo is they don't seem to be in a hurry to upgrade OS. My TAB2 is still running Android 5 and my A12 is on 6. I don't see an upgrade on the horizon. Other than that, I love both products and Lenovo support has been helpful when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Marv

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I got gift cards for Mothers Day and wanted this. So I used my gift cards immediately and purchased this item! I do not regret it at all. It boots up fast, the 10 inch screens offers up clarity and sharpness making it easy to see and use! It is such great quality for the price. And I can read my Nook books on it! That was a big plus! If I had it to do over, I would buy it a gain! My daughter was so impressed with the quality, she bought one!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Try using a stylus on this
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this as a gift for me. I use it to highlight study materials. I can highlight with my large fingers and sometimes get what I want. I have tried 5 different stylus which all work on other laptops with no problem. With this tablet I can underline with the stylus only if I apply excessive pressure which is not good for the stylus or the screen. Will probably go back to my old tablet and ignore this one. I am not a novice to computers or tablets, so I feel this tablet is defective or poorly designed. No usable help found on the Lenovo forums.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet. Did all the necessary updates as soon as I connected the WiFi. I have not noticed any lag while working on it so far. The internal 16gb memory is not enough. Must get a micro sd card (at least 32gb ) if you have a lot of photos or videos on the internal SSD. It has very little propitiatory apps to clutter and slow down the operating system. So that's a PLUS too.
customer_reviews.author: pcwizz

customer_reviews.title: May look good at first but beware
customer_reviews.text: Purchased tablet in Feb. of 2016 and it is now Sept. charging slot got sloppy right away and it will not turn on or charge as of 09/08/2016. Look at Lenovo forums to see this is a common issue and they do not even reply on their own forum to help. Almost $200 for a tablet that lasts less than a year will have you buying more of them than the cost of a single tablet from a company that stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Teigh

customer_reviews.title: dont buy if you want to update
customer_reviews.text: I like this tab..love the size, had to return the first 1 because after all the updates I to had problems with sound cuting off and wifi, I return it got a 2nd one and decide to stay with kit kat and not upgraded...work great, speed is great , picture quality is good. Hopefully lenovo would work out the bugs so we can update.lenovo supports sucks....stick with amazon or apple, first class customer service
customer_reviews.author: M.wal

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Have been jealous of all the iPads out there but have resisted having to learn a whole new Apple language for many years so was looking for something as just as nice. This is it! Quick, bright, clear, and paired with the bluetooth keyboard cover, I easily use it as a portable work station even in a cramped plane seat. I'm not a gamer so can't tell you about that, but can say it's the fastest system I've ever used for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the money
customer_reviews.text: A very good tablet for someone looking for excellent battery life, a display bright enough to use outside, and medium-power processor. I bought this tablet to use as a controller for a Behringer XR18 stage mixer. It was intended to be used as a backup controller to my iPad4, but it compares to the Apple so well that I use it regularly. It does not have two features that I miss: automatic display brightness and quick-charge capability for the battery. But for under $200, it is well-suited for this use.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hunyady

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet; a couple of small complaints
customer_reviews.text: I can only feel the "click" of the on/off button if I use my fingernail, rather than my fingertip. My iPad's switch is much easier to use. It takes the Lenovo much longer to boot up than my iPad. Also, for the one app I use (Behringer X-Air), it is not very responsive to a stylus. Again, the iPad is superior in this regard. But I don't know if the flaw is within the tablet or the app; The iPad app comes from a different source than the Android app.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Lenovo rocks a great tablet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loving this tablet. The one I received, purchased about Jan. 3......, has the 1.7 chipset in it not the 1.5. Also it has 5.0.1 Lollipop loaded on it already..... No upgrade needed. There was a firmware upgrade available , that went smoothly without a hitch. Some people claimed to have a problem with the WiFi chipset not hooking up well with the router, especially after upgrading to Lollypop, but I have not had problem one. Hooks up fast and is rock solid on my router. For the price you get a lot of tablet for very little money.
customer_reviews.author: John Farey

customer_reviews.title: Useless after a year
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this tablet for 1 year and 3 months, very light use. It now won't turn on, and about 6 months ago the volume would only get half as loud and it was performing very slow. Total waste, would have been better off shelling out more money for something that would last longer
customer_reviews.author: Murky Mere

customer_reviews.title: What a deal!  Fabulous screen and amazing battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tablet at a real bargain price. Terriffic screen and the battery life is AWESOME! Had it in sleep mode for 2 weeks and it still had most of its charge. Great little tablet at a great price. Paired it with the IVSO detachable bluetooth keyboard & cover (2015 version) for $39 and got a fantastic duo for $102 total.
customer_reviews.author: fauxqueen

customer_reviews.title: The Android 5 update works great for us - and it seems to get updates ...
customer_reviews.text: There are only issues we have had with this tablet: The touch function is sometimes not very sensitive when using the keyboard. WiFi will sometimes drop, but comes back quick by going to WiFi settings and selecting the network again. The Android 5 update works great for us - and it seems to get updates every few weeks. Wish I could say that for my Samsung tablets. This seems to be the best tablet for the money with a large high resolution screen.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Cheap tablet that works great until it overheats
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these in the last 3 months. Each time about 30 days after receiving them, they start overheating. The tablet then shuts down gets physically hot on the back to the point of causing pain when touching and becomes unusable. The first tablet had this occur 35 days after first use. The second 23 days after first use. It's a shame because the tablet works great otherwise and has a very reasonable price point. Unfortunately I can't keep buying and returning these so my 3rd tablet will be a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Kohler

customer_reviews.title: Two Must Have Features This Lenovo Does Not Have!
customer_reviews.text: Its actually a good tablet with two issues which I find important. First, its pretty heavy which means it has good battery life but its not as light as some equivalent units out there. Second, it has a wimpy WiFi adapter engine. In several side by side tests with my girlfriend's Galaxy Tab A trying to hook up to public WiFi signals, the Galaxy was connected and running fast while my Lenovo could not/would not connect up. I returned the unit, sorry to say.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Dahle

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tablet at the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this as replacement for an old Acer tablet which lasted 5 years but could not keep up with current technology...The Lenovo runs smoothly when browsing and has a nice display. It's also thinner and lighter than my older Acer tablet. I use it for browsing and as a controller for my audio apps and they all run well with this. The processor seems to have enough power for most tasks. The question will be...will it last :) Also, you're stuck with Android 5.1 which I'm ok with, I prefer stability and functionality to having the latest OS.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Tablet has glitches and still no repair from lenovo
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet in july 2015 and gave it as a gift to my father. He loved it and cared for it meticulously. Then the glitches started...problems with charging the device followed by the screen freezing up. Called lenovo and since it was in the warranty period they told me to ship it to them (at my cost mind you) for repair. The repair or replacement was supposed to take two weeks. It is nearly a month and I haven't received anything! I'm sure I will be spending several hours that I really can't afford to spare chasing this down. I'm so disgusted!
customer_reviews.author: New Mom

customer_reviews.title: Lenovo does a great job with this tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice full HD tablet at a good price point. I was not thrilled that it was using a mediatek processor, but after reading some reviews I thought I would give it a try. I also like that it came with 2GB RAM, which is also rare at this price point. I was extremely pleased how well this performed. For a 10" full HD tablet under $200 there are no other real competitors in my opinion. I installed KODI on it and it runs great. You would probably need to spend at least another $100 to get an Android tablet with similar or better specs.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect specs
customer_reviews.text: Specs listed in the item description were wrong. At least it had a better processor than what was listed. Be advised that what I received was a Tab2 A10-70. Again, what I got was better than what was listed but I expect to be able to research a product before buying and this poor description actually made that impossible. It also makes it impossible to verify star reviews for a given product because you really don't know what people are providing a rating on.
customer_reviews.author: Bramofon

customer_reviews.title: Pissed! Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Good thing this isn't available anymore... what a joke! I bought this in mid Sept '16. It won't turn on, it won't charge. I look up the warranty to get it fixed... get this they sold it to me a month after the year warranty expired
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle C Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Works great but a few kinks.
customer_reviews.text: Writing this review on the tablet itself. CONS: 1) Only 16Gb, it's 2015 ! 2) Settings background is white, no way to change, w/c is glaring 3) No auto-brightness for display 4) And No Way to change the Lock Wallscreen to a custom image??!!! Firmware is latest at the time of this post, had this for 3 wks now. Please Lenovo, fix the above in a future update! ;-) Other than the above, it works fast & great!
customer_reviews.author: Bisdak SysOp

customer_reviews.title: It does its job.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this tablet, actually I read reviews before buying and some people said that this is somewhat an iPad from Apple, but for my experience is not even close to Apple products. It’s an okay product for the price, slow at times, the camera is not that great and the sound is horrible, I thought Dolby sound was a great thing but is just whatever. I like it, I barely use it so whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: For the most part the jury is still out on this tablet. I guess i shouldn't have expected it to more than a $168.00 tablet. All of the positive reviews lead me to believe this was the most awesome tablet ever! it's no better than the Lenovo Yoga tab 2 (which is what I was replacing). When held side by side, I could not see the difference in the picture quality. This boots a little faster than the Yoga, but otherwise, curb your expectations, you are after all, buying a tablet for under $200.00
customer_reviews.author: Rick R.

customer_reviews.title: The tablet is great, and I have not seen the lack of ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a Amazon flash sale for $20 off the current price. We have a 2.5 year old, so buying a $300-400 table is out of the question. This tablet will be lucky to last the year. The tablet is great, and I have not seen the lack of performance or sound quality noted by other reviewers. Maybe a software update problem? The sound quality is great, picture is great, and the construction is decent (still plastic, but firm enough for me). The tablet will be going in a case with a screen protector, so hopefully it will survive our daughter. I may buy another one if the price drops again.
customer_reviews.author: Leo and Renee

customer_reviews.title: Love this tablet!
customer_reviews.text: After having returned two defective Chromebooks in a row, I was a little hesitant to make another Amazon electronics purchase, but I'm so happy I did. Previously I had a Nexus 7, but so far I'm liking the Lenovo better. Time will tell if it holds up better than the Nexus did. The Lenovo is great for viewing movies, touchscreen works well, no problems to date.
customer_reviews.author: AN43

customer_reviews.title: This tablet is great, especially for the cost
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is great, especially for the cost. Both front and rear facing cameras are comparatively better than most tablets on the market. Photos turn out great. I had a slight issue out of the box with playing videos. Using youtube etc, the video would freeze up momentarily then catch up. Installed a string of operating system updates. Solved the problem. So, I would recommend updating the software immediately after turning it on for the first time to avoid the momentary disappointment. Very pleased with this tablet. Lenovo hit it out of the park with this.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Goedhart

customer_reviews.title: Impressive value!
customer_reviews.text: I continue to be impressed by the *bright, crisp screen* - even on battery-conserving low brightness setting!! Colors are beautiful! It's also very fast AND responsive using a stylus. I was a Nexus 10 "snob" til screen developed lg scorch (common). Replaced w/ no-name tablet that was awful (comparable price to Lenovo Tab 2). This tab is budget priced but an excellent value. Lenovo website is cumbersome & unhelpful, tho, and recharging my brand-new tab is profoundly slow (hence, generous 4 stars, more like 3.5).
customer_reviews.author: Sharon M.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Experience
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this tablet. I have had WiFi connect problems. Keep getting retry connection messages. It works well within 20 feet of the router, but what is the point of a tablet if it is not mobile. Same issues with connecting to the Internet. I am very disappointed in this product. I expected more from Lenovo.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: and looks great. I also like how it has a volume ...
customer_reviews.text: First off, the price can't be beat. It offers full 1080p resolution, and looks great. I also like how it has a volume button on the side so you don't have to actually adjust they volume using the touch screen. I don't do much on this other than watch Netflix, browse on the Internet, and use Amazon, so I haven't experienced any kind of lag. I'm not into games, so I can't offer any opinion about that. Overall, I'm probably gonna get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Revolution Now!  A great alternative to the iPod.
customer_reviews.text: So slick, so smooth, so fast, so NOT APPLE! Think of it: a removable micro SD card, standard hdmi output, standard chargers, no constant demands to log into the Apple store or nagging for auto updates. And the price is right compared to iPads. Don't get me wrong, I like my iPad and my iTouch but it is refreshing to have an Android in your hands also, makes you feel like a revolutionary.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: No more Windows for me!
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly great tablet! As a student I use the device mostly to read PDF files, view spreadsheets and power point presentations. All of the above work flawlessly and the screen is vibrant and bright. Additionally, I have a bluetooth mouse and keyboard connected which I like for precision and adding notes to digital documents. Youtube and web browsing are a pleasure and the sound in headphones (cheap ones I might add) is luxurious and warm. Go ahead and ditch your laptop, this is lighter and the battery lasts all day.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet with nice visuals and stellar sound
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tablet with nice visuals and stellar sound. There are however several issues with this tablet. Basically, these tablets are notorious for being incompatible with certain common wifi settings. It took me a while to get it properly connected to the internet without disconnecting again. Also, the build is made with plastic and feels cheap and fragile. Overall its a nice tablet to have but a bit overpriced..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Samsung for my use!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many tablets. I use them with special software to turn them into a kiosk and these work prefectly. The resolution is higher than the Samsung Tab A's that are more expensive so I have switched and now only use the Lenovo TAB2
customer_reviews.author: Glenn W.

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review
customer_reviews.text: I've had the tablet since the 15th of August and it has malfunctioned (not even 15 days have passed). On the highest level you can barely hear it. The surround sound was working fine at first. Little by little the sound kept going up and down in volume without me adjusting it. I will be returning this item. I'm disappointed, it started off as great and now it's useless without proper sound.
customer_reviews.author: franknettie

customer_reviews.title: Great performance; major charging problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Lenovo TAB 2 A10-70. They perform exceptionally well; great value performance-wise for the price. However BOTH had to go back to Lenovo for charging/battery issues, one of them TWICE and the other just 5 days out of warranty. It seems charging is a common issue for these tablets as it took them over a month to repair for lack of parts. Basically the connector gets loose over time And eventually falls to charge at all.
customer_reviews.author: GEF

customer_reviews.title: Bad model, or lemon product?
customer_reviews.text: Lasted less than two months. Went to turn it on today and completely dead. Put on charger but no help. Still dead. Will have to take it in for warranty repair or replace. I have another older lenovo tablet that is still working fine after two years. So what is the problem with these newer tablets?
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful value, would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's absolutely fabulous buy. Had it for couple of month, no problems whatsoever. Power consumption is excellent, can stream a 3.5 hour game on full sound on 10% of charge. The tablet came with the pretty recent version of Android OS installed, I didn't have to do any upgrades. Plenty of storage space, I could comfortably install all my applications, for banking, work-related, media-players and book readers. I don't use camera at all, so I cannot say anything in this aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Galina from VA

customer_reviews.title: ... and I bought this for my wife as something easy for her to use to do Facebook and also ...
customer_reviews.text: We are in our 60's and I bought this for my wife as something easy for her to use to do Facebook and also access the internet sites she likes. The picture on this is extremely sharp and bright with great colors. For the price the tablet exceeded my best expectations. It handles the task as an additional wireless receiver on my Direct Tv with ease.
customer_reviews.author: John parsons

customer_reviews.title: Not happy right now
customer_reviews.text: I loved the tablet, beautiful screen and fast, but after 6 months, its completely dead. Won't charge or turn on. I may see if amazon can do anything for me or look into getting it serviced by Lenovo.
customer_reviews.author: K. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Condition, Great Mid-Range Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I was lost when my Note Pro 12.2 broke. And the cost to replace it was more than I could afford. I loved that tablet, and was wary of getting something different. Especially used. This tablet arrived in perfect condition and fully wiped. Not a noticeable scratch on the unit! The 'book' style case that was sent with it is also in great condition and works great to protect it and prop it up. The device itself performs well, as long as you don't overtax it. Considering I wanted a device primarily for reading and websurfing, it does everything I need at a very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Ryo Misaki

customer_reviews.title: Great screen but no support for multiple users
customer_reviews.text: Best display on a 10 inch android tablet for the money. Solid, lightweight build and performance is good. Downside is that Lenova's Android 4.4 implementation leaves out multiple users-- this is a showstopper for some though my wife and I can live with it as you can have multiple Gmail accounts. There is a path to Android 5.1 though many who upgrade report significant nuisance or worse issues.We'll live with 4.4 and enjoy the great screen.
customer_reviews.author: Oxman

customer_reviews.title: I was not happy with this tablet
customer_reviews.text: I was not happy with this tablet. It stopped working on my daughter within a couple months of receiving it. As we've had too many issues with the cords and connectors of all the tablets we've attempted to give her, we opted to buy a laptop for her instead. She is much happier with the newer one as are we cause it still works. Could be we just received a bad tablet but... Personally I'll never buy another tablet again.
customer_reviews.author: Vortigern Black

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this tablet
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this tablet. After a year the battery is significantly weaker but still easily acceptable. It needs a good SD card. I lost a lot of apps and files on up grading the operating system. You need to put as much as possible on the SD card and make a list or separately back up to an outside device all apps and their caches.
customer_reviews.author: Clem Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around tablet
customer_reviews.text: I've had my tab for a couple of months now, and it has worked flawlessly. I read Kindle books on it, I watch Netflix, I watch Amazon Prime Video. The battery life is good (it sits idle for days without being plugged in, and lasts about 10 hours of constant web access, perhaps 6 hours of constant video). I wish the speakers were in the bezel facing forward, but they are in the back. I also wish that it had a faster charging option.
customer_reviews.author: simuloid

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely thrilled with this tablet! I bought it to use for movies on long car rides and it has surpassed all expectations! Battery lasts forever (was playing movies/shows for 8 hours and only used 55%). I downloaded 15 tv episodes and 6 movies and it still runs fast and has 4gb of storage left. Sound and graphics are fantastic! Would not hesitate to buy again or recommend. So happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great budget tablet solution
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to basically take the place of an aging ipad and a rooted Kindle Fire. I couldn't be happier. The price was great, and setup was easy. I run my home media through a Plex Media Server on my Window laptop, and downloading the android Plex app and connecting to my server was easy-Parcheesi (whatever that means). Movies are clear and bright, and streaming music through headphones is great. Email and web surfing are quick and intuitive. I would recommend this tablet for anyone looking for a high quality budget tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Weston

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Tablet.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Tablet. I am not tech savvy, I don't even own a smart phone. I got this so I could step away from my desktop computer and view quilting tutorials in my sewing room. It works great for my purposes, and I'm glad I bought it. The only reason I do not Love it, is because I often have to touch the screen several times before it responds to me. I get irritated, and wonder if this is normal for tablets in general or just this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jryman

customer_reviews.title: Best Value Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised by this device. The device is very responsive and the screen is good enough for me. The only con is that after my updates I cannot root Lollipop Android. I am not sure if this is a processor issue or a Lollipop issue. It runs better than expected so I am not disappointed at all and have zero regrets with this purchase. I do not use root for much but i like to be able to make device modifications. Not having root will probably save me from myself, if I know me.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I installed all of the updates and did a system reset before using it, so that may have avoided some problems people have reported. It has a great screen, plenty of battery life, and is more than fast enough for my needs. Audio is loud enough, but doesn't get super loud. The touch screen takes a slightly firmer touch than my phone and the construction is a bit plasticy. Over all you can't beat it for the price - I don't see any reason to buy something costing twice as much for only minor improvements. Did I mention the great screen?
customer_reviews.author: Beesley

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for the price, but now disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Good Product for the price. No Mhl to cast to TV or Actiontec ScreenBeam Mini2 Wireless Display Receiver or wold easily be 5 stars. UPDATE April 2017 I've had this 1 1/2 years now and for the last 3 months the power button has been acting up. Now the tablet is not even charging. Come on Lenovo, you can do better than that.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon

customer_reviews.title: The screen is good quality, touch is and I'm able to surf ...
customer_reviews.text: Wanted an Android tablet and after reading several reviews ended up with the Tab 2 A10. Only complaint is it takes a little too long to boot in my opinion and if I had to do it over again I would buy the Flip Chromebook instead as I really only use it for surfing the web and take with me when I travel. The screen is good quality, touch is and I'm able to surf the internet at good speed. The size is good and I like the fact that I can increase the on board storage, something you can't do with an I-Pad. Overall a good buy but not quite a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: T.Waldron

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet for even CLOSE to the money.
customer_reviews.text: It's better than I hoped for, and I am a pro geek. There are NO ISSUES with the current Android version and this new (2016) tablet. Ignore all the horror stories; they are no longer relevant. Audio issues are also resolved on the new tablets. Video is best in class. Speed is good. I love to complain. I can't. Best tablet for even CLOSE to the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bran Englander

product_meta.title: Lenovo TAB2 A10 - 10.1" Tablet (ARM Cortex A53 Quad-Core, FHD IPS, 2GB SDRAM, 16GB SSD, Android 4.4 KitKat) ZA000001US
product_meta.description:
Processor Description:ARM Cortex A53 Quad-Core| Size:2GB RAM| Style:FHD IPSA tablet that's full of premium features, at an affordable price. The versatile Lenovo TAB2 A10-30 tablet has it all - superb 10.1" HD display, lightning-fast LTE connectivity, dual speakers with Dolby Atmos technology, the latest Android OS, 16 GB of internal storage for music, games and photos and all-day battery life. Perfect for first-time tablet buyers who want non-stop entertainment on-the-go, without breaking the bank!

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Android 4.4 KitKat (Up gradable up to latest OS)
16 GB Flash Memory, 2 GB RAM Memory
Built-In Lithium-Ion Providing up to 10 Hours per Charge (7200.0 mAh)
Android 4.4 KitKat, 10 inches FHD IPS LCD (1920x1200) Display
This tablet is powered by a 64-bit quad-core 1.5 GHz MediaTek MT8165 chipset and has 2GB of RAM

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,570 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
